intro: Asterocephalus daucoides, commonly known as the star-headed carrot, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
